attributes.comment:
The fee increases you are proposing for adoptive families are absurd. We pay
enough already. Perhaps you should improve your service before attempting to
double the fees. We've gone through one international adoption and are in the
middle of our second. The level of incompetence we've experienced from USCIS
has been mind blowing. How on earth do you justify increasing the fees and, in
some cases, doubling fees with the lack of service you provide? There is no
justifiable reason as to why the fees should be increased as much as you are
proposing. In some cases, there would be a 66% increase. It appears that you
are attempting to double the fee for a certificate of citizenship. This document
should be wholly unnecessary, yet families who adopt from Korea must obtain
one and pay an already unconscionable fee. The law states that my child is a
citizen from the day he is adopted by me. Yet for no good reason, I have to get
Certificate of Citizenship in order to prove to our government that he is a citizen.
This money-making scheme has clearly been proposed by people who have never
gone through the adoption process. Families who adopt internationally already
have to pay a minimum of $20,000 in order to adopt a child. There is no reason
as to why we should be further gouged by our own government. Please re-think
your proposed fee increases for I-600, I600A and N600 forms. I, as well as many
in the adoption community, would like to know the reasons behind such a large
fee increase.
attributes.title: Comment Submitted by Katherine
